Module com.example.cab302tailproject
Package com.example.cab302tailproject.controller.teachercontroller

Class LessonGenController

java.lang.Object
com.example.cab302tailproject.controller.teachercontroller.LessonGenController
public class LessonGenController extends Object
Controller for the Teacher's Lesson Generation view. Handles user input for lesson/worksheet generation, interacts with the Ollama service, prompts for saving content, and manages navigation to other views by directly switching scenes on the current stage within each action handler.
Version:
1.6
Author:
Your Name/TAIL Project Team

  • Constructor Details

    • LessonGenController

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the controller after its root element has been completely processed. Sets up the radio button toggle group and the file chooser.

    • assignWeekAndClassroomToContent

      public boolean assignWeekAndClassroomToContent(int materialID)
      Assigns a week number and classroom ID to the specified material in the database. The method determines the appropriate week and classroom based on the current teacher's session information. If the teacher information is unavailable, default values are used to update the material.
      Parameters:
      materialID - The unique identifier of the material to which a week and classroom are to be assigned. Must not be -1.
      Returns:
      true if the operation to assign week and classroom to the material is successful, false otherwise.

    • updateTeacherIdToContent

      public boolean updateTeacherIdToContent(int materialID, String type)
      Updates the teacher ID associated with a specific content material in the database. The method retrieves the teacher's email from the user session and assigns it to the corresponding content identified by the material ID and type. If no email is found in the session, the operation is skipped.
      Parameters:
      materialID - The unique identifier of the material to which the teacher ID is to be assigned. A value of -1 indicates invalid material and will prevent the update.
      type - The type of content material (e.g., "Lesson Plan", "Worksheet") to be updated.
      Returns:
      true if the operation is successful or if no email exists in the session, false otherwise (e.g., an exception occurs or the material ID is invalid).
